title: 109_hr4438
content: The "Gulf Coast Recovery Act of 2005" may be cited as the short title. Public assistance allowable costs are addressed in the Act. The President may provide assistance to eligible State or local governments for reimbursement of expenses incurred for employee base pay and overtime related to disaster declarations for Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. States or local governments must demonstrate eligibility to receive assistance. The President may provide assistance to State or local governments that have suffered a loss in operating revenues due to disaster declarations. The loss must equal or exceed 25 percent of the annual operating revenue. Essential governmental services include fire, law enforcement, emergency medical, public works, emergency management, planning, and building codes services. Employees involved in the permitting and inspection process for building code enforcement are also covered. The President may provide 75 percent reimbursement for eligible building code services expenses incurred by State or local governments. Eligibility determinations must be completed by June 30, 2006. SEC. 3 of the Community Disaster Loan Act of 2005 is amended to limit disaster loans to 50% of the local government's operating budget for the fiscal year of the disaster. SEC. 4 addresses the federal share for debris removal. SEC. 4 addresses the Federal share for debris removal activities related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita, ensuring a 100 percent Federal share under certain conditions. The President shall contribute at least 75% of the cost for hazard mitigation measures approved within one year of the enactment of the Act for disaster declarations related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The percentage of total contributions under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief Act is increased from 7.5% to 15%. The amendment increases the percentage of total contributions under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief Act from 7.5% to 15% for major disaster declarations made on or after August 29, 2005. SEC. 6 extends unemployment assistance for individuals affected by Hurricane Katrina or Rita for 52 weeks with a minimum of 50% of the national average weekly benefit. SEC. 7 addresses emergency equipment assistance. SEC. 7 addresses emergency equipment assistance under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act. The Director will provide grants to States and local governments for purchasing interoperable communications equipment that meets national standards, facilitates coordination between emergency systems, and ensures effective communication during disasters. Grants will also cover mobile equipment for emergency power generation. The program aims to enhance response capabilities of States and local governments during disasters by providing grants for purchasing emergency communication equipment and mobile power generators. Technical assistance will be offered for equipment procurement and installation. $200,000,000 is authorized for this program annually. The program authorizes $200,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2006, 2007, and 2008.
